# Referencing

## Plagiarism {background-image="img/logo-dark.svg" background-size="auto 50px" background-position="right 15px bottom 15px"}

&nbsp;

> Plagiarism occurs when ‘people draw on or directly replicate someone else’s work and, whether intentionally 
or not, pass that work off as their own’. This is both poor scholarship and a breach of academic integrity. You 
are expected to submit original work for your assessments and to acknowledge all sources upon which you 
have used.

MPhil Handbook, p.10

&nbsp;

::: {.center}
*Avoiding plagiarism is the low bar for referencing*
:::

## When and how to cite {background-image="img/logo-dark.svg" background-size="auto 50px" background-position="right 15px bottom 15px"}

&nbsp;

:::: {.columns}

::: {.column}

Use citations for:

* Factual claims
* Invoking a literature
* Highlighting a work
* Extended discussions
* All quotes

:::

::: {.column}

Provide pages for:

* All quotes
* Obscure or underappreciated points

:::
::::

## Styles {background-image="img/logo-dark.svg" background-size="auto 50px" background-position="right 15px bottom 15px"}

* For assessed work, use any common format, but...
   * Footnote citations count as words
   * Numbered references are harder for markers
   * I recommend **APA**: 
      * *Citation*: (Lanfear, Kirk, and Sampson 2024)
      * *Reference*: Lanfear, C. C., Kirk, D. S., & Sampson, R. J. (2024). Dual pathways of concealed gun carrying and use from adolescence to adulthood over a 25-year era of change. *Science Advances*, 10(49), eadp8915. https://doi.org/10.1126/sciadv.adp8915

* Outside this program, it is largely determined by publisher
   * Swapping journal means swapping styles
   * Footnote references are elegant
   * Endnote references are awful

::: {.center}
*Regardless of what you use, don't do them manually*
:::

## Zotero Desktop {background-image="img/logo-dark.svg" background-size="auto 50px" background-position="right 15px bottom 15px"}

Many useful features:

* Store metadata on any kind of reference
* Create notes nested within entries
* Tag references for sorting
* Account features:
   * Sync library and notes across computers^[There is a limit; be careful backing up PDFs!]
   * Free back up!
   * Access through the Zotero website


## Zotero Connector {background-image="img/logo-dark.svg" background-size="auto 50px" background-position="right 15px bottom 15px"}

Easily add items to Zotero from your browser:

* Repositories, e.g., JSTOR
* Google Scholar
* Journal and publisher websites
* DOIs and ISBNs
* Directly from some PDFs
* News sites

## Style management {background-image="img/logo-dark.svg" background-size="auto 50px" background-position="right 15px bottom 15px"}

* Visit the [Zotero Style Repository](https://www.zotero.org/styles)
   * Major styles: Chicago, MLA, APA, etc.
   * Discipline styles: ASA, AMA, etc.
   * Journal-specific styles: Springer, Science, etc.
* Set style in your word processor document preferences or in Quarto using `.csl` files
   * Updates all in-text citations
   * And the bibliography!

## Word processor integration {background-image="img/logo-dark.svg" background-size="auto 50px" background-position="right 15px bottom 15px"}

* Word & LibreOffice:
   * [Plugin available](https://www.zotero.org/support/word_processor_integration)
* Google Docs:
   * Part of Zotero Connector!
* RStudio:
   * [Built-in!](https://rstudio.github.io/visual-markdown-editing/#/citations?id=citations-from-zotero)
   * Insert references in Quarto visual editor
* Apple doesn't allow plugins in Pages!
   * Bad Apple!

## In-text modifications {background-image="img/logo-dark.svg" background-size="auto 50px" background-position="right 15px bottom 15px"}

You can make a lot of modifications within the word processor:

* Multiple items in single citation
* Editing existing citations
* Hiding authors
* Adding page numbers, chapters, tables, figures
* Adding text within the parentheses (e.g., “see also”)
* “Refresh” to update modifications you make in the desktop app


## Other features {background-image="img/logo-dark.svg" background-size="auto 50px" background-position="right 15px bottom 15px"}


* [Groups](https://www.zotero.org/groups/)
* Exporting your library
* [“Locate”](https://www.zotero.org/support/locate)
* [More resources](https://www.zotero.org/support/)
* “Upgrade” your storage to support Zotero
